name: Cardinal Climber
climate: Cardinal Climber thrives in warm climates with temperatures ranging from 70°F to 85°F.
The plant is highly adaptable, growing well in both tropical and subtropical climates.
It can handle high humidity as well as some arid conditions if given proper care.
Not frost-tolerant, best grown as an annual in cooler climates or indoors.
sunlight: Requires full sun exposure to thrive and produce vibrant blooms.
At least six to eight hours of direct sunlight per day is ideal.
Will tolerate partial shade but may result in reduced flowering.
Inadequate sunlight will lead to poor growth and fewer flowers.
watering: Water consistently, keeping the soil evenly moist but not soggy.
During hot periods, may require more frequent watering to prevent wilting.
Avoid allowing the soil to completely dry out between waterings.
Mulching can help retain moisture and regulate soil temperature.
soil: Prefers well-drained soil that is rich in organic matter.
Sandy loam soils work well as they provide good drainage and aeration.
Avoid heavy clay soils that can retain too much moisture and cause root rot.
Soil pH should be slightly acidic to neutral, ranging from 6.0 to 7.0.
toxic: Cardinal Climber is considered toxic to pets if ingested.
extra_care_tip: Provide a trellis or support for climbing, as it can grow rapidly and needs space to climb.
Pinch back the stems to promote bushier growth and more flowers.
